headline.main: THE DUTY ON RAILROAD IRON.; Speech of Mr. Seward in the Senate, against the Proposal to Abolish or Postpone that Duty.

docs.lead_paragraph: MR. PRESIDENT: I regard the propositions submitted by the Senators from Illinois (Mr. DOUGLAS) and Virginia (Mr. MASON) as synonymous. I think it requires no prophet to foresee that to suspend the duty on Railroad iron for three years, will be virtually to suspend it indefinitely--that is, to repeal it altogether.

docs.lead_paragraph: GAMBLING.--A few weeks since we noticed the breaking up of a gambling crib for boys, by the First District Police, on the Heights. On Sunday night last, officers Fox, THOMPSON, CAIN and TOOLE, of the Third District, made a similar descent upon a house in which games of chance are played, in Hamilton-avenue near Columbia-street, kept by one O'NEIL.
